-- Global variables
-- GB101A01 - Save old values
-- GB101A02 - Calculate new values
... calculated in GB101A5 - Store Invoice account changes
... calculated in GB101A11 - Calculate insurance commission
- 1. Bookings required, else terminate GB101 immediately
-- First the INVO row has to be locked exclusivly to avoid changes on the same
invoice if GB101 is called multiple times from different programs
INFO: The lock on INVO will be unlocked according to the transaction level
in the calling program of GB101
.. client currency
.. general currency
.. invoice currency
.. old markcode
.. new markcode
-- Update INVO_DUMMY to perform a database update, uses to lock the INVO row
-- INFO : Table MARK is recomputed if the parameter below is updated (therefore
the value has to be passed as parameter), see R.S. Part 3
-- 3. Is it allowed to remove the markcode?
... if finance contract then silo program must decide if finance is possible
... initial updates
... restore old Markcode before dispute
-- 4. In case of new markcode set factoring account to 0
-- 5. Check finance markcode at debtor level
-- 6. If new markcode is max finance time exceeded set factoring account to 0
-- Store global values
-- client currency
-- general currency
-- invoice currency
-- Step1: Set initial values
-- Step2: Eliminate rounding differences
-- Step3: Set final values
... invoice currency (is calculated before the call of BCM015, v.SPECIALNEWI is
used as parameter for BCM015)
-- Calculate extra finance
... client currency
.. general currency
... invoice currency
-- variables to calculate the milliseconds with GB542
... old markcode
... new markcode
... old markcode
... new markcode
@Table MARK_CODE is selected separately in A08 because the old/new markcode
could be updated in one of the previous steps (see example A02)
Part 1: Handle old markcode
Part 1-1: Client currency
Part 1-2: General currency
Part 2: Handle new markcode
Part 2-1: Client currency
Part 2-2: General currency
... old markcode
... in case of dispute is solved
... new markcode
@Table INVA is selected separately in A10 because of updates in A03, to make
sure that always the actual amounts are used

SQL_STMT_U.val: select max(INUD_BALANCEFACTORINGC) from :1/INUD where INUD_INVO_NO = :2 for fetch only

Text.val: -- Get tax percentage (87) for Insurance commission (GB199D)
... set variables, used in A12 - Update Account changes

SQL_STMT_U.val: select cast(sum(SCHI_INSURANCECOMMC) as decimal (16,5)) from :1/SCHI where SCHI_INVO_NO = :2 for fetch only
select cast(sum(IACH_INSURANCECOMMC) as decimal (16,5)) from :1/IACH where IACH_INVO_NO = :2 for fetch only
